title: I wanna convert lots of jpegs!
content:
Does anybody know of a freeware [Win/DOS] utility that can perform JPEG conversion on multiple files at once? Either with a GUI or a command-line based program would be fine.

There's always Advanced Batch Converter, but I loathe shareware--I'll donate to freeware projects, but I won't pay for shareware, especially $40 (US!) for a simple image conversion utility. And I'm sick of looking up cracks.

If there's nothing around, I guess I'll have to invest some time into making my own. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

title: Wanna convert jpegs...
content:
No special features, but a clean interface, maybe this will work?
[url=http://www.simpleforme.com/files/ImageConvert.zip]www.simpleforme.com/files...onvert.zip[/url]

title: *experiments*
content:
That's a tasty piece of software you've whipped up, Zach, but I forgot to mention one thing: I need to be able to modify the compression settings and image size. Thanks for the effort, though--it may be handy for PNGs and such.

I tried ImageMagick, but couldn't work out how to do multiple files at once. convert doesn't seem to accept wildcards like * for the filename.

Oooh. XnView seems perfect for converting, though it doesn't seem to allow me to change the image size. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

title: Re: compression and size
content:
If you don't find another option that works, I should be able to add compression settings. (It will be a little more work, but I was looking at it yesterday and it should be possible.)

When you say "image size", are you talking width and height (pixels) or size on disk (bytes)?
Pixels should be quite easy. But size on disk is entirely dependent on compression settings (and color depth).
In either case, could you suggest how you'd like to input these settings?
(For example, would you want to say "I want all of the pictures I select to be converted and be the same size." or if you want different sizes for each image, how would you like that to work out?)

title: Re: compression and size
content:
By image size I mean the x and y dimensions. By compression I mean size on disk. So both.

Something like [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/illustration/jpgdialog.jpg[/img], but including width/height. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris
